Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the cost difference between California and the rest of the nation in building and maintaining a mile of road.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient supporting evidence or data to validate the stated cost difference.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the high cost of building and maintaining roads in California is solely due to inefficiency and wastefulness of the California Department of Transportation (Caltrans).
Exist alternative explanation: The expert suggests that there is a debate about the reasons behind the high cost of road construction in California, indicating that there may be alternative explanations beyond the claim made by John Cox.
